channel.title: Rat
channel.description:
hey i need some help about something. I was told i was ratted by this kid on a rsps
How would i go on about removing it even if i didnt get ratted, i would like to know how to get rid of one :confused:

item.title: Rat
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

Fall-and-Your-Pets-Pesty-Pet-Control.jpg468×627

Purchase RATAK it’ll find any rats you need to remove, the pic above was mine from a few years back. You can find it at Best Buy/Walmart/etc. It works on Win XP and above

Read full topic

item.title: Rat
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

A RAT can be undetectable for a anti virus scanner…

Download Winpatrol and open it. Go to active programs and remove every not trusted .exe
Go to startup programs and remove the .exe that you dont know.

This should remove it.

Read full topic

item.title: Rat
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“matiasmunk, post:19, topic:444769”][quote author=Omer_ link=topic=547457.msg4015110#msg4015110 date=1339549739]

Y’all tards… Anti virus programs, won’t help shit if the RAT is FUD.
This is how you’d do, to make 100% sure to remove it and it’s gone.

  1. Go to start.
  2. Open up ‘run’
  3. Type in ‘msconfig’
  4. Go to ‘start’ inside msconfig.
  5. Hit ‘Deactivate all’ or whatever it’s named. (It’s a button)

You computer will now ask you to reboot, and then you of course do it.
This will deactivate all programs to start up when you boot your computer.
Your computer will then, look for the stuff which is important, such as your Anti-Virus program & stuff like that, and activate that.
After doing this, you’ll be 100% certain that all malware on your computer is GONE for sure.

If you’d like stuff to startup, such as MSN, Skype, Steam etc… Then just head back to Msconfig and just check, MSN, Skype, Steam etc… Whatever you’d like on.
Mostly malware will be from the, Publisher: Unknown, in there.

Hope this helped

Rat: Remove administration tool

Remote*

Watch out, we’ve got an HF guy over here.
[/quote]

HF is a site full of skids. I don’t give a fuck about them. I am registered on there tho, yes.[/quote]

So are 1.3 million other people.

Read full topic

item.title: Rat
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Look around your C:, C:\Windows, or C:\Windows\System32 folder. Usually wannabe hackers will hide shit in there. Look around for a ‘svchost.exe’. It should only exist in C:\Windows\System32, otherwise it is probably a virus and it is safe to remove it without losing any internet connectivity/anything internet related.

Read full topic

item.title: Rat
item.dc:creator: @tranomo tranomo
item.description:
@tranomo wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:12, topic:444769”][quote]
I was told i was ratted by this kid on a rsps
[/quote]

Ok, so what do you actually mean?

  1. A kid on a RSPS told you that you were ratted by someone
  2. Someone told you that a kid on a RSPS ratted you

Oh yeah, and 90% of people that make these threats have no clue of what they are talking about.[/quote]don’t you mean 100%?
also if this guy’s been ratted there wouldn’t be many major signs, but if there was an anti-virus, of any kind, on the computer of the OP then there would be some sort of detection. Less there’s some new kiddie ‘fud’ that works… I’ve never seen a RAT get passed a good anti-virus. A good trojan made by the right programer might, but never a RAT. Those things are pathetic.

Read full topic
